title: Co-op boss admits all 6.5m members had data stolen in cyber-attack
description: CEO Shirine Khoury-Haq says hackers stole contact details of all members but not financial data such as card numbers
content:
The chief executive of the Co-op has apologised to its customers after admitting that all 6.5 million of the mutual’s members had their data stolen in a recent cyber-attack.
Shirine Khoury-Haq told the BBC she was “incredibly sorry” for the attack in... [3117 chars]

title: Court rules against raising triple murderer Nicholas Prosper's sentence to whole life order
description: Prosper was sentenced to jail for a minimum of 49 years in March, which the solicitor general branded as "unduly lenient".
content:
Prosper may still never be released
Lady Chief Justice Baroness Carr told the appeal court: "Appalling though these crimes were, we are not persuaded that anything less than a whole life order was unduly lenient.
"It is a sentence that requires a you... [308 chars]

title: Boy, 6, kills newborn baby after 'being left to roam hospital's maternity ward'
description: The baby suffered a head injury after being dropped on the floor, an investigation source claimed.
content:
A criminal enquiry has been launched in France after a six-year-old boy ‘left to roam around a maternity unit’ allegedly killed a newborn baby. The horror unfolded at the Jeanne-de-Flandre Children’s Hospital in the northern city of Lille.
It was the... [2474 chars]

title: Europe's holiday hotspot hell: Videos show streets groaning with crowds and huge queues at famed beauty spots in Italy and Greece - despite raging anti-tourism protests
description: Swarms of holidaymakers can be seen packed shoulder-to-shoulder and forming huge queues waiting for trains and buses in some of the most beautiful destinations in Italy and Greece .
content:
Europe's most famous holiday hotspots are busier than ever this week - despite anti-tourism protests taking place across the continent.
Images show swarms of holidaymakers packed shoulder-to-shoulder and forming huge queues waiting for trains and bus... [11182 chars]

title: Skin swabs could detect Parkinson’s seven years before symptoms appear
description: It has long been known dogs and even some humans can 'sniff' Parkinson's Disease on humans before they are showing symptoms.
content:
Nurse consoling Parkinson's patient by holding her hands
A simple skin swab based on the powers of 'super smellers' could detect devastating Parkinson's disease up to seven years before symptoms appear. While scientists have known for years that dogs... [5710 chars]
